title: Children in England ‘living in almost Dickensian levels of poverty’
description: Children’s commissioner says any Labour strategy to tackle deprivation must scrap the two-child benefit cap
content:
Children in England are living in “almost Dickensian levels of poverty” where deprivation has become normalised, the children’s commissioner has said, as she insisted the two-child benefit limit must be scrapped.

title: Trump tariffs explained: what’s changed and why have Asian countries been hit so hard?
description: The shifting timeline of Trump’s tariffs, the most significant US tariff increase in nearly a century, has roiled global markets and caused widespread confusion
content:
US President Donald Trump has ramped up threats to impose punishing tariffs on more than a dozen nations unless they can broker a deal before 1 August, marking the latest phase in his trade war.

title: Drugs smuggled into prisons 'destabilising' them, watchdog says
description: Prisons inspector's report finds bored inmates and staffing issues are exacerbating demand inside.
content:

title: Property prices flat in June amid signs UK job market may be ‘softening’
description: Expected interest rate cuts could support growth after fall in first-time buyers since end of stamp duty cut
content:
The housing market was flat in June as signs emerge that the UK jobs market may be “softening”, one of Britain’s biggest mortgage lenders has said.
